chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In the previous two lectures we have completed scaling of continuous time signals.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: The next basic operation is shifting.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Whatever we are going to learn in this lecture we can definitely apply on discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So I will not upload separate lectures on basic operations of discrete time signals.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Shifting is of two types.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: The first one is time shifting and the second one is amplitude shifting.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In this lecture I will explain time shifting and in the next lecture we will deal with

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: amplitude shifting.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Let's say the original signal is xt and after time shifting, after time shifting the new

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: signal is equal to yt.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In case of time shifting we add a constant to the time.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Let's say the constant is equal to small k.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So signal yt, the new signal is equal to x inside the bracket t plus k.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So if you compare xt, the original signal with yt, the new signal, you can see there

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: is difference in time.

chunks.Text: Here we have time t but here we have t plus k and as we are adding k to the time t, k

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: is also a time and it is constant and generally it is given in seconds.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now depending on k we have two cases.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In case number 1, in case number 1, k is greater than 0 or we can say k is positive.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: The original signal, the original signal xt is defined like this.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: It is equal to 0 when time t is less than 0.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: It is equal to 2 when time t is less than equal to 2 but it is greater than equal to

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: It is again 0 when time t is greater than 2 and once you plot this, you will have the

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: waveform like this and now we will perform the time shifting.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: We will perform the time shifting with k equal to plus 2 and as k is equal to plus 2, case

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: number 1 is satisfied and we will find out the new signal which is yt.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: yt is simply equal to xt plus 2 because k is equal to 2 and we will first see one example.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: We will try to understand how we have to perform the time shifting using this example and after

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: that we will plot the waveform for the new signal yt.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In this example, there is a time bomb with timer indicating 10 minutes and this time

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: bomb will explode at 12 minutes.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can see two wires in this time bomb and when you cut the red wire, the bomb will explode

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: 2 minutes earlier.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: The bomb will explode 2 minutes early and when you cut the green wire, the bomb will

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: not explode and let's say by mistake you cut the red wire, so what will happen to this

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: time bomb?

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: As soon as we cut the red wire, the time bomb will explode.

chunks.Text: The bomb was about to explode at 12 minutes but now it is exploding at 10 minutes.

chunks.Text: So by cutting the red wire, we are reducing the time by 2 minutes or we can say we are

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: adding 2 minutes to the instantaneous time.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: 10 minutes is the instantaneous time and we are adding 2 minutes by cutting the red wire

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: to the instantaneous time to explode the bomb.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So let us try to summarize this thing.

chunks.Text: When we add 2 minutes to the instantaneous time, the event will occur early by 2 minutes.

chunks.Text: Here the event is explosion of the time bomb and in general case we can say that on adding

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: the time to the instantaneous time, the events will occur earlier.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: I will use this concept to plot yt, the new signal which is equal to xt plus 2.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So here we are adding 2 seconds to the instantaneous time and because of this we will get everything

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: 2 seconds early.

chunks.Text: In case of original signal xt, when time t is equal to 0, xt is equal to 2.

chunks.Text: When time t is equal to 0, xt is equal to 2.

chunks.Text: This means x of 0 is equal to 2 and in case of new signal yt, we are getting everything

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: 2 seconds early.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: 0 is the instantaneous time and 2 seconds early means time t equal to minus 2.

chunks.Text: So y of minus 2 is also equal to 2.

chunks.Text: y of minus 2 is also equal to 2.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So 2 seconds early means t equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So y of 0 is equal to 2.

chunks.Text: Now we have the complete information to plot the waveform of the new signal.

chunks.Text: When time t, when time t is equal to minus 2, yt is equal to 2.

chunks.Text: When time t is equal to 0, yt is again equal to 2.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: I will join these points and the resultant waveform is the waveform of the new signal.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can clearly see the whole waveform, the whole waveform is shifted to the left by 2

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: seconds.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So this case, the case number 1 in which k is greater than 0 is the case of left shifting

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: or you can say time advance.

chunks.Text: This is the case of left shifting or we can say time advance.

chunks.Text: So generally it feels like the signal will move forward or you can say the signal will

chunks.Text: be delayed but in reality the signal will be advanced depending on the value of k.

chunks.Text: Now we will move to the next case of the time shifting.

chunks.Title: Time Shifting of Continuous-Time Signals

chunks.Text: of right shifting or we can say this is the case of time delay, this is the case of time
